Message.Title: Sell DELL?
Message.Msg: Let's see. Dell has cash and short term investments of $14.818 Billion and total debt is $9.254 Billion. That's $5.564 Billion in hot cash and with 1.75 Billion shares outstanding, the effective cash per share is $5.564 / 1.75 = $3.18 per share. Dell is expected to make $1.70/share and with the share price at $11.24 and subtract $3.18 for cash, it's trading at a P/E of ($11.24 - $3.18) / $1.70 = 4.74. It's cheaper than HP, much cheaper as HP's balance sheet is ridden with lots of debt. I wonder, really wonder who sells at this price! There is a big misconception that DELL is a PC company but if you look at the revenues per division, it's less than 1/4 of their total revenues and people value as if it's 99% PC. Clueless!! This is from their Balance Sheet: "Broken out by global segment, Large Enterprise represented 30% of DELL's FY 12 total revenue (29% in FY 11), Public 27% (27%), Small and Medium Business 24% (24%), and Consumer 19% (20%)."

Topic.Title: Private Equity is looking to take Dell private

Message.Msg: I have repeatedly stated that some analysts ( Jim ) have a personal agenda ... their negativity seems deliberate, IMVHO and self serving ... your facts are truly spot on ... don't be guided by the " short " comments of analysts that have not been guiding the public with the facts...

Message.Msg: DJI will be up more than 100 points today and DELL will boost up big time just watch. DELL is a solid company with healthy earning, more than $3 billion cashed earned each year for investors. You want to short DELL, go ahead.
